Description: Plain text file. Contains unformatted text.

Structure: Rows separated by new lines, columns by commas.
Description: Stores tabular data (like spreadsheets) in plain text.

Structure: Rows separated by new lines, columns by tab characters.
Description: Like CSV, but columns are separated by tabs.

Structure: Nested key:value pairs using curly/bracketed notation.
Description: Stores data in a readable, structured format.

Structure: Indented text with key:value pairs, uses dashes/hyphens for lists.
Description: Stores configuration or structured data in a readable text format.

Structure: Text with custom tags in angle brackets enclosing data, similar to HTML.
Description: Used to store and transport structured data with custom tags.

Structure: Zipped XML, organized into sheets, rows, and columns.
Description: Spreadsheet format often used for tabular data and charts. **CAUTION**: be wary using Excel to manipulate domain-specific data as the programs used to read Excel files often do automatic formatting that may be unwanted.

Structure: Organized in columns for efficient querying.
Description: Columnar storage file format for big data. Efficient for reading and writing large datasets.

Structure: Objects representing pages, text, graphics, and metadata.
Description: Used for documents, reports, and images. Not easily machine readable for data retrieval or parsing.

Structure: Database tables and indexes stored in one file.
Specifications: SQLite :octicons-link-external-24:, Wikipedia page for SQLite software :octicons-link-external-24:

Structure: Directory structure, files compressed and bundled together.
Description: Compressed folder/archive format. Bundles files and reduces size.

Structure: Concatenated files with directory structure, not compressed.
Description: An archive file that bundles multiple files and folders together without compression; known as a "tarball."

Structure: Compressed representation of a single file.

Description: A collection of files and folders first bundled into a TAR archive, then compressed with gzip for efficiency.
Specifications: See above for links to `.tar` and `.gz` formats.
